title: Consultant, Mission Systems Engineer
description: We are looking for a detail-oriented and collaborative Mission Engineering Analyst to support business analysis and requirements engineering efforts within the Mission Engineering team. Reporting to the Senior Mission Engineering Manager, this role focuses on capturing stakeholder needs, defining system requirements, and supporting traceability across complex Defence projects. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and interpersonal skills, with a keen interest in systems thinking and mission-focused capability development.
requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Systems Engineering, Business Analysis, or a related technical field.
Experience in requirements engineering or business analysis roles desirable.
Strong analytical thinking and structured problem-solving abilities.
Familiarity with requirements management tools (e.g., DOORS, Jama, or similar) is desirable.
Good communication and facilitation skills, with an ability to interact with a range of stakeholders.
Awareness of the systems engineering lifecycle and requirements best practices.
Awareness of MBSE tools or approaches (e.g., SysML, Cameo, Enterprise Architect).
Experience working in Defence, aerospace, or similarly complex domains will be highly considered.
Basic understanding of Defence capability development frameworks and acquisition processes.
Able to obtain a security clearance up to a NV1 level, and desirably an active clearance.

companyInfo.description: Deloitte Canberra predominantly focuses on the Defence Sector, Federal Government and the various Intelligence Communities and local private enterprises.

benefits: Deloitte Flex - We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility
Buy and sell leave - purchase up to 6 weeks of extra annual leave
Mentoring and development programs – receive support and coaching to progress your career
Retail discounts
Wellbeing leave
Paid volunteering days
Twelve flexible working options
Market-leading parental leave and return to work support package

title: Software Engineer - Solutions Engineering
description: Canonical is seeking a Software Engineer for its Solutions Engineering team. The role involves working with Python and Golang to design and deliver open source software operations code, working with the entire Linux stack, and shaping high-quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure. The position is ideal for those passionate about distributed systems, cloud computing, and the Linux stack. The role requires global travel up to 10% of the time for internal and external events.
requirements: Passionate Python developer
Organized and timely delivery of high-quality software
Understanding of reliable operations in an agile world
Sound knowledge of cloud computing concepts & technologies
Practical knowledge of Linux and networking
Lifelong learner

companyInfo.description: Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems, known for Ubuntu. The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing, with a focus on global distributed collaboration.

benefits: Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

title: Ubuntu Sales Engineer (Entry-Level)
description: We are hiring an Ubuntu Pro Sales Engineer to help global companies embrace the latest and greatest Linux and open source applications. This role involves applying expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling enterprise adoption of Ubuntu Pro, OpenStack, Canonical Microcloud, Kubernetes, and associated technologies. The role is suited for candidates with a technical background who are business-minded and driven by commercial success. It involves working closely with enterprise sales leads and requires global travel up to 25% of the time.
requirements: Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
Intermediate level Python programming skills
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings

companyInfo.description: Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with most colleagues working from home.
